review: Food was okay as usual. They have been advertising about bigger ribs and burgers but my ribs were still small ( looked smaller)

If I could, I would give zero stars. This place makes me want to never eat at any Chili's ever again, and I won't. Angela Fox, I would highly suggest you train your staff before your restaurant loses business and shuts down for good because I see it going in that direction if my experience is anything to go by.  My family and I just had dinner here. We're not super picky or finicky but the service here was just horrendous. Right off the bat, we were seated at a booth where the seats were wet, which made my pants damp. I got up and my sister asked our host if we could have some napkins. Rather than offering to wipe down the seats for us or getting a server to come with a dry towel, the host named Jason, gave my sister a single napkin. You heard that our seats were wet and so was our table. What were You expecting us to do with one napkin, Jason??? So my sister asked if we could have a few more, and he sarcastically grabbed a large stack and asked, "Is this enough?" Okay, whatever. We let that go. There was food on the ground which my sister tried not to step on.  Our server (I didn't get a name) took our orders and brought our food but never once returned to our table to offer refills or napkins. It's not like the restaurant was full. Where did he go? Why didn't he bother to check on us at least once when we needed napkins and got to the end of our meals with empty cups?  Maybe we should read the reviews on here before dining. Angela Fox, I got your name off of the door where you're listed as the General Manager. Please take these reviews seriously. Train your staff and have them clean up the place. I'm very surprised that nothing has changed because it seems like others on here have had a similar experience.
The chicken crispers were underdone. Could not eat them.

You've been to one Chili's, you've been to them all...at least that's the case for me! The food is a hit or miss but tonight it was a hit! I got the 2 for $20 with Cajun chicken pasta and Texas French fries! I got my order to go and there was no confusion!
Beef Enchiladas were gross burger bun was shining with grease (as if the burger wasn't greasy enough) . Apple juice had no sweetness. Fries were good. Won't be back here anytime soon

Not sure if I care for the interior, but it appears to be more accommodating to larger parties.   With a party of 2, we find ourselves eating in the bar area more than the restaurant ...you'll get a table faster.   The food is good.  Their menu continues to grow which can become overwhelming to customers.  And when they add new items to their menu, you that either take off your favorites or don't include them in specials. Their wait staff is hit-or-miss when it comes to service.  You can place orders and pay for your food via their table top computers.  The food is good and they make a pretty good margarita.

Do we have to tip? I guess so. This server/customer business model is dying. Tired of depending on someone to release me into the public.. after waiting for someone to bring a lousy refill or just shut up and do your job. I don't mind placing an order, walking 20', and not having to pay $9 to angry undeserving server with attitudes. Or waiting for them to find your food that is cooling and bring it. Tipping has been rendered useless.

The food is ok. The service leaves a LOT to be desired ! I order the half rack of ribs and a loaded baked potato.  They brought my food out. The ribs were a little tough and they brought mashed potatoes. When I told them I ordered a baked potato. I was informed that did not have baked potatoes,  but mashed potatoes are the same thing ! REALLY ! I had to beg my waitresses for refills on my tea. after asking 3 time, I finally got something else to drink to wash the dry ribs down. I will not be back to the Irving TX location.

We were seated immediately. The service was good. She gave us extra napkins which is always a plus for me and refilled drinks without being asked. We ordered an appetizer which took forever. I was hoping it would not come with our entrees but it did. It defeats the purpose of munching on something while waiting.  The food was average. I must say the cooked was generous with salt. It would be nice taste the flavor of the food other than salt.
We waited for the host for about 15 minutes and he was watching the t.v the whole time while the manager just walked around.

This is my favorite location. Its always quick and fast. The food is always amazing. And the restaurant is always clean. I love the reward system. Also they have great waitresses/waiters. This location is always quote busy though. Other than that, they get 5 stars from me.

I stopped in for a to go meal. We made the order at the bar which was probably a mistake, should've went to the window labeled TO Go. It took forever to get our food and of course, it was all room temperature upon arrival.  Hmm,  I wonder how long our food was sitting in the window ready? This obviously effects the flavor. Even blah food can make it if it's hot and you're hungry as hell, as I was tonight.   I ordered chicken fajitas, cadillac style. Where do I begin. Chicken was minimally flavored. Rice was hard, seemingly undercooked. Despite awesome sounding fixings - pickled jalapenos,  guacamole,  sour cream, salsa, Pico de Gallo - my fajitas proved significantly underwhelming. I only scared them because I had entered into a hunger - induced irritability. My other plate on the ticket was a triple dipper consisting of chicken crispers, sw egg rolls and big mouth bites. All room temperature damn near reverting to its frozen taste. The bartender was overwhelmed by the drink orders coming in though she was decent enough. For $30, it reaffirmed why I don't really ever eat at Chili's. It's been years since I've been there and looking at their new menu I was impressed but my food told the tale. Maybe dining in would've proven a different experience.  Ah well.
Ice cold beer and fast service you can't beat that especially the ice cold beer the food was good and fresh come in and try it out.

Overall the dining experience was lacking. After finally being shown our table we sat for at least 30 minutes and our server never came. We had to stop a random worker to get our food & drinks ordered and NOW a solid hour into we have no food and empty glasses.
The customer service at this location is always good and they manage the crowdedness with great execution. I love love love the Patron Margarita :-) I prefer to do happy hour here rather than to eat.

YOU KNOW MY FATASS LOVE THIS PLACE!  LET ME SKIP THAT SIDE SALAD AND DIVE INTO THESE HERE RIBS BABY And you know the ribs and the only thing I be nimbling on HEYYY ;) I'm single by the way baby Everytime I go here and that if very frequently (I dont mind a first date here baby;)  The staff is just the right about of friendly, If you're anything like me you would hate waiters hovering above you while you eat and keep asking if you need anything BITCH! Why the fuck would I need anything with basically half a burger in my mouth If I needed you I would wave you over! But I also hate when waiters are hiding when I'm trying to pay the damn meal! Like hello! You want this cash money bling bling or not?! The food is flavorful and low price  Very high on calories so beware But for me personally I need to keep the pounds on because I know these black and mexican men like they women big! Hugs and kisses to my single men ;)

I just returned from a thoroughly unsatisfying lunch experience. I decided to split the 2 for $20 deal with a coworker since there were a few of the "lighter options" on the 2 for 20 menu. Tried the Mango chile tilapia which was somewhat salty but otherwise okay.  I paid $1 more for the fresco salad and that was disappointing. for my second side i chose broccoli which was the best part of the meal.  The other entree was the 6 ounce sirloin - absolutely terrible. Extremely salty and almost completely gristle. The other person who ordered it tried to cut around the gristle but gave up since there was no actual meat within. So we switched. Officially the worst piece of meat I have ever eaten. They also had the beans - extremely salty. We ordered the guacamole as the appetizer. If you are betting I will say salty then you would be 100% correct.  For $27 with tax and tip it is safe to say that I will be avoiding chili's in the foreseeable future. For that amount I can have way better food in Irving (Andalous or Kebabs to Go just to name a few). I just have to write this review down so that next time when someone suggests Chili's I can glance at this and say...I'll pass.

Stopped in with 4 co-workers for a "quick" lunch.   One co-worker ordered a salad with fried chicken strips.  All of the food took too long to arrive.  The salad arrived about 10 minutes after the rest of the order - and was so cold and greasy that it was immediately returned.  That co-worker had nothing to eat, but we still had to ask for her food costs to be removed from the bill.  Poor food quality.  Poor service.  Bad lunch.

I have been to this Chili's twice very recently and I have to say, the staff is so positive and friendly, it makes me want to come back! I was particularly impressed with our waitress, Brandi; she was very upbeat and had just the right balance of not interrupting our conversation but being around enough to be helpful. Thanks to the waiters and waitresses, this Chili's is a really happy place.  The quality of the food is also quite good; you always know you'll be happy with what you get. The reason I didn't put 5 stars is because I think in general, Chili's has really gone up in their prices - It used to be affordable (but not trashy) family dining. Now it's quite expensive! I went to lunch by myself and paid $17 for a pasta plate and a soda. :( That being said - You get what you pay for, in a good way - Very friendly, accommodating staff & satisfying food.

Came here for a nice lunch with my mom and sis. The food was good. I enjoyed it, I really did. This Chili's menu has so many options, I was very pleased. However, what I wanted wasn't on the 2 for $20 and thought I could make a substitution.    I brought this up to our waitress who rudely said,"No we don't do that" in the same rude/monotone voice she greeted us in. (Note: the restaurant was noisy and our waitress was very tall). It would probably be a good idea for her to bend down if she couldn't hear. But no, whenever I ordered she said,"Sorry did you say something?" very condescendingly.    She came around once after we got our food to ask how we were. I guess it just wasn't her day...

My husband and I agree that this location deserves three stars. Tables and Booths were all dirty. New ziosk machines and salt & pepper shakers  also sticky and dirty. Tables not pre-set with silverware for lunch crowd. We got there at 11 and were originally sat in a closed section. Server was hurried and somewhat friendly. Food was good. We had a voucher and needed to pay our server but had been told to use the new machine. However it's not equipped with the ability to accept it. We waited almost 5 minutes for someone to return but just ended up grabbing a manager. He was fabulous. Very friendly and helpful. I wouldn't really consider going back due to the cleanliness being sub par.

I came in for dinner tonight for a party of two. The hostess informed me the bar was open seating, as they are at all Chili's locations. However, when I asked her to have a server bus the dishes off an open table, the hostess refused and said it wasn't her job, and a server would do it when they get around to it. Since there was no sense of urgency I proceeded to put my things down anyway and waved at the bar server for assistance. Before I could even sit, a different hostess stopped me and said she could not seat us unless the table was cleared, and she would get fired if she allowed it. Excuse me, but didn't the other hostess say the bar was open seating? Because of their incompetence, I literally picked up my things and walked right out. A note to management: fire your current staff and replace them with people who know what they are doing. You have lost my business and if I could give this location a rating of zero stars I would. I will never come back here even if you paid me to.

We had a great dinner here! So many birthdays! It was a blast. The hostesses were friendly and nice. I like that you can look at the menu/order at your table using an electronic touch screen device. Our waitress Naomi was so great keeping our bottomless chips and salsa full, bringing extra napkins, plates, and drinks. She was on top of things and the food was great! I suggest the blackberry sweet tea, it was just right. Also, the Mango Chili Tilapia was good but you probably need a sweet tooth if you are going to order it. Thanks for reading and enjoy!

My mouth was watering - my eyes were closed - I was savoring every last minute with my big. . . juicy. . . steak! Yes, I enjoyed a steak from Chili's. My boyfriend and I enjoyed the 2 for $20 deal and everything was pretty great. The drinks are a little too pricey and a little more watered down so that is why they don't get 4 stars. OH, the little computer game they have at the table is pretty neat! My man and I had some VERY interesting conversations thanks to the couple oriented games they have.

Probably won't go back to this one again after a random waitress randomly wrapped her arms around me and hung on me with all ther weight.  First of all, personal space invasion no doubt.  Second of all, I have severe back problems in need of surgery and can't have anyone hanging on me without causing lots of pain.  No, there's no way she could've known such a thing but she also shouldn't be hanging on random customers.

I love this Chilis!!!! Management is awesome, the staff is fast and super friendly! They will do anything to make sure you have a good time!! There email club is also pretty cool! I get tons and tons of free coupons daily! Love you guy!!!!!!!!!!!

Another Chilis. Nothing wrong with this place. They have some decent lunch specials now. A soup/salad with Sandwich and fries for between $7 and $9.  I had the chicken quessedila instead of the sandwich and got Jalapenos instead of the bacon. It was very good. The soup ( chicken and green chile) was good too. My colleague had the combination fajita with beef, chicken and shrimp for $15.  It was way to expensive for the food which had over half the dish filled with onions Decent food, decent service.
Always love it here! Food and margaritas are delicious :))) waiters are nice and give a great service.

Chili's is consistant and that is what I like about it.  You always know what you are going to get. I will say though that I was less than thrilled with the chili at this location. It was bland and not very flavorful.

I went here last Saturday and had a terrible experience. Our waiter was all over the place and just didn't to seem to have time for us. Granted, there were two different tables in the restaurant celebrating birthdays for their kids but that doesn't mean I should have to wait 15 minutes to get a refill on a Sprite. It sad when you have to chase down somebody like you work there. By the way, if you know you're going to sing a birthday song to some kid because it's part of your job then being obnoxious as possible while you do it really makes for a awkward experience for people who are just trying to enjoy their baby back ribs. This actually happened twice within 20 minutes of each other and trust me, the second show was even louder and obnoxious than the first show. Order our food was also a hassle because the original waiter that took our order and wrote everything down and walked off and about 10 minutes later a new server came over an indicated she heard some of what we ordered from our previous server but he said he wasn't really paying attention and to just go ask us again. My first question I was thinking after bein told was, "Then what was the guy writing down on the notepad? Doodles?"  This was not the first time my experience was unpleasant and I won't be dining inside anymore. The 'to go' area is quick and friendly and I fully recommend that. If you really want to eat inside then I suggest going to the Chilis in North Irving in the Los Colinas area.

SUPER CRAZY FAST SERVICE! We ordered and our food was out in no time!  Our waiters were really nice and attentive.    This is my second time here and even with it being a busy Friday night we didn't have to wait long.  Food was great and hot and drinks were good!
Food was just okay...my Steak was so little... I didn't realize that a 6 oz was the size of a Baby Foot...I probably would go somewhere else with my friend girls next time!!

The menu seems to have greatly improved. Service was quick and the waitress was very attentive. All we  had to do was look up and she would come over and ask if we needed something.  The "light" menu could use a few more varieties of items.

The burger was good, but not as I ordered.  Sat at a dirty table at the bar and you can tell the lone bartender is overworked having to  take care of 8 tables, 8 seats at the bar, to-go orders and making all the drinks for the  restaurant.  All the busy Chili's I have been to have two bartenders and even they were sometimes overworked. And it would be nice to get a smile instead of the look of panic from a server. It is not her fault, it's bad management for not staffing right.  An overworked staffer does not make for a pleasant dining experience.

15 mins for drinks....they forgot about the coffee i ordered. Very short staff but servers and management didnt seem to budge too much. Servers are very lazy. Wont introuduce themselves Lack menu knowledge Lack customer service skills Wont be coming here again. Rather go to McDonalds at least they know how to greet themselves in a professional manner

I don't like coming here on weekends, because this place is always jumping (yay for them!). Today is a Wednesday, food hot, drinks cold, one awesome waitress handling all this area by herself. Took her a minute, but she made sure I knew she wouldn't forget us. Once order was in, we got our food in a flash. Love this place during the week, get to relax and move at my pace.   Thanks for a great afternoon!
I like the menu at Chili's and find myself here offen especially when traveling.  I can always count on Chili's to be clean, service to be great, and to find something tasty.
Rude people! Nobody to greet or sit you down!! Waited 4 min at the four getting ignored. Never will be back!

I could not tell you about the food here. but i can tell you about the service. There was not any. we walked in and there were 3 people in this place. 2 of which were in the bar area.Needless to say they were not busy at all. We stood there waiting to be seated almost 10 minutes ,and we were seen because i made eye contact with at least 2 of the waitstaff. Finally ,we both got frustrated and left to go eat at on the border across the way.
Spend 3 hours there on a date. The service is great! Margaritas are pretty decent, however I would have liked to know the blueberry one was $10 before I ordered it :)

Went to this Chili's again the other day.  So disappointed in the experience.  Our door was very slow to get to the table. It was 40 minutes from the time we were seated until our food arrived.  I was watching the tables around us and it was similar for everyone.  My wife ordered the mango Talapia and when she took a bite it tasted like pinesol or some other cleaner.  It was in edible and we has the general manager "josh" come over. He claimed to not be able to smell it at all so I guess we were both crazy. Yea I took a bite too. Had to spit it out.   Told the GM we would not be back for awhile.  On the flip side, I love the Chili's in Flower Mound. It is always good, fast service and the staff are very friendly.   I'm sure this is a case of the GM and how he cares about his customers. Sic. He was not at all empathetic and the apology was half hearted.  I guess we will stick to On The Boarder across the parking lot.  The general manager c

Okay, it's a Chili's... everyone knows what you are getting. BUT this review is needed. Because they have made some exciting changes at this location (and possibly others - I'm not a Chili's frequent flyer). My beau and I came in on a Sunday after church and we were pretty lucky to grab a spot in the bar without a wait. Larger parties were waiting to be seated and restaurant was buzzing, but there definitely was some space for smaller parties. We were quickly given a crash course on a new system called Presto that changed what would be an average dining experience for the better. Pretty much, it's a self service tablet where you can view the menu, place orders, and even pay for your meal when you're ready. It is so stinking easy to use and really a fun concept! It also has games and other features for tables with kiddos. I hope that more restaurants will start to use this system (or something like it) in the future. It's a pretty nifty feature and sets the well-known Chili's brand apart.

After several mediocre experiences at this location I went against my better judgement on the day of my birthday for a quick dinner since I had received a notice that I would also get a free dessert. I ordered and ate, then debated on even getting the offer but decided I would. I was asked to put my phone number into the machines at the bar and it said "whoops!" And that I didn't have an account. I showed them I had received rewards emails the same day and asked if there was anything they could do. After not only telling them it was the actual day of my birthday and showing them the email I had received I was denied by the bartender and also the manager Rick. I am appalled as someone who has worked in the restaurant industry that a manager values a slice of cheap cake over a customer's satisfaction. This is the first time in my life I have not left a tip. If someone tells you it's their birthday, even if you can't find it in your company's bank to fork over the promised cheap cake, you can't even SAY happy birthday to them? Absolutely horrible service and I will never be going back, no more chances for this place. Hope this review finds anyone before they choose to as well.

Service was beyond excellent. I cannot remember the name of our server, but she did above and beyond taking care of us. We ordered off of the 2 for $35 menu, and our food was amazing. I highly reccomend the bacon ranch quesadilla. I cannot wait for my next visit.

Chili's being one of my favorites, my motto is "What can go wrong at Chili's?"  Well, I found out yesterday.  We walked in.  No one greeted us, even though a few employees gawked at us while we stood there for about three or four minutes before anyone ever acknowledged us being there.  Then the hostess appears, coming from outside with her pocketbook in her hand, asked if we had been helped.  I told her no.  She kinda looks around, slowly puts her pocketbook away and walks us to a booth.  The seats were filthy, with crumbs, something wet and a big chunk of "something" in the seat.  So I asked her to clean it.  I had also noticed how dirty the floors were.  So far nothing is going right at this Chili's, and my gut feeling to RUN was overwhelming so I told her never mind.  I wasn't in the mood to spend $ for a bad restaurant experience, so we left before she even finished cleaning the seats.

Friday July 12, 2013 this Chili's was my first time there. But, they have made some changes,they have this new system called Presto Tablet on your table, it let's you order your food and drinks thru the tablet and they will come to your table. I thought that was really neat. It even let's you check out at your table and,have your receipt emailed to you. Now I love that!  My lunch was great! small portions to eat and not be too full for work. Thanks Chili's my experience was great!

I actually never liked Chili's for the longest time, but I bit my tongue and went with my boyfriend.  My only real problem with Chili's is that their chicken was always greasy and gave me food poisoning, but they've changed since I've decided to not hold a grudge... They have new flatbreads that are to die for! The crust is perfectly crisp and the basil pesto taste soooo good! And no food poisoning three times eating there ;) The new Presto tablet type thing with the games, and you can order on it and pay was amazingly fun and nice to have. Perfect for impatient people. Waiting service though....we have had the most amazing waitress, Jessie, twice. She was kind, compassionate, and really cared to serve us.  But the last time we went, we had an awful experience with Jerremy, but I won't take off a star just for a bad apple.

Never fails to satisfy. For some reason we always get sat in the section along the windows overlooking the parking lot and Target.  We always get the same waiter, I think Karl, and he's pretty good. I'm here all the time!

I went on Saturday and I asked for reservations  but we still had to wait.... then we had 10 ppl and the waiter was so rude she was a tall black lady it was 10 people and instead of her walking  over to everyone she decides to stay in one spot and one end of the table and had us YELL our drink orders and food order so my friend said "corn on the cob cut in half" she yelled it 3 times since the waiter dint come to our end... and my friend  yelled  did you get my order and the waiter said  yes all annoyed like okay i heard you ...  then they brought it back it WASN'T cut in half.... .... really.... then when she came back she would have us pass down the drinks instead of her handing it to us... then we told her we had 2 more people coming in and she said "what yall gonna do"  like as if she can't help us get a table.... so then we just decided to ask the host... the host was so friendly and so nice we asked her for more other than the waiter... then we never got asked if we wanted refills we would have to tell her our selves... she never came by often.... so she really ruined our night we wanted a different waiter... our party of 12 was dissatisfied  and im.only giving a 2 because of the awesome host

Chili's is Chili's.  You're not coming here for innovative cuisine or a unique atmosphere. Why we come: low cal menu makes my stress of finding food within my calorie counts vanish.  Even during peak times, we've never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes.  Service at this location has always been good and efficient.  Food is good value, especially if you go with the 2 entrees and an appetizer for $20.
